basics.name: Thomas Zoldowski
basics.summary: Embedded systemsâ€“focused Computer Engineering student experienced with STM32 development in C and rapid prototyping on bare metal or RTOS. Comfortable bringing ideas from schematic to tested hardware with Altium Designer and solid lab/debug practices (oscilloscope, logic analyzer, JTAG/SWD). Currently learning Rust for embedded to deepen reliability and safety.

work.summary: Worked as a co-op in the Controls Engineering department, contributing to robotic and automation solutions for industrial clients.
highlights: Designed and implemented HMI interfaces using FactoryTalk View SE.
Programmed FANUC and ABB industrial robots for various manufacturing tasks.
Developed and tested PLC logic for systems including laser etching automation.
Collaborated with cross-disciplinary teams to bring automated cells from concept to commissioning.

work.summary: Supported the design, documentation, and testing of SCADA and PLC systems for municipal and industrial clients.
highlights: Built a high-performance SCADA system using VTScada based on existing PLC logic.
Programmed Rockwell PLCs using Ladder Logic in RSLogix500 and Studio 5000.
Created O&M documentation for client handoff and commissioning.
Tested and debugged PLC control panels against electrical schematics and field hardware.

publications.name: Autonomous Line Following Robot
publications.summary: Designed and implemented a PD-controlled robot using an Arduino Uno to follow a track using only sensor input. Developed custom chassis in SOLIDWORKS and tuned control logic for real-time path correction.

publications.name: Vending Machine
publications.summary: Built a vending machine using the STM32F446RE microcontroller with coin detection, keypad input, LCD display, servo motors, and a secure admin system. Integrated custom state machine logic and hardware interface design.

publications.name: Karaoke Machine
publications.summary: Designed a stereo karaoke audio system using analog components, including op-amps, microphone preamps, audio mixing circuits, and power amplifiers. Created custom speaker housings and tested full system performance.
publications.award: Selected for Project Day showcase (1 of 2 projects selected by class vote).

publications.name: Digital Monster Pet
publications.summary: Developed a standalone virtual pet using the STM32F446RE microcontroller, RTC, sensors, and a graphical LCD. Simulated emotional states and health logic using embedded firmware, with EEPROM-based data retention.

publications.name: Frog Flap FPGA Game Emulator
publications.summary: Created a sprite-based game emulator on a Spartan-7 FPGA with HDMI output, randomized object generation, layered animation, collision detection, and synthesized audio playback using logic modules and IP cores.
publications.award: Selected for Project Day showcase (1 of 2 projects selected by class vote).

publications.name: Shot Counter System
publications.summary: Designed a compact shot counter with custom 6-layer ENIG PCB, OLED display, and piezo knock sensor using the STM32F103 microcontroller. Enabled real-time tracking and menu-based interaction with over 7 hours of battery life.
publications.award: Selected for Project Day showcase (1 of 2 projects selected by class vote).
